channel.title: Cory K. Costello on Cory K. Costello
channel.description: Recent content in Cory K. Costello on Cory K. Costello

item.title: Do You Feel Like Who You Follow? A Network Approach to Predicting Individual Differences in Mental Health on Twitter
item.description: Costello, C. K. & Srivastava S. (2019). Do You Feel Like Who You Follow? A Network Approach to Predicting Individual Differences in Mental Health on Twitter. In Costello, C. K. & Srivastava S. (Chairs), The Difference Engine: Advancing Personality Science With Digital Records of Language, Networks, and Behavior. Symposium conducted at the 2019 Biennial Meeting of the Association for Research in Personality (Grand Rapids, MI.)

item.title: Longitudinal Stability and Change in the Big Six
item.description: Costello, C. K. & Srivastava, S. (2019). Longitudinal stability and change in the Big Six. In G. Saucier & S. Srivastava (Chairs), Longitudinal Stability/Change in Personality Understood Broadly: Beyond the Big Five. Symposium to be conducted at the 2019 Lifespan Social-Personality Preconference, part of the 20th annual meeting of the Society of Personality and Social Psychology (Portland, OR).

item.title: Ethics-Relevant Values in Adulthood: Longitudinal Findings from the Life and Time Study
Consensus, Accuracy, and Consequences of Hearsay Reputations
item.description: Costello, C. K. & Srivastava, S. (2018). Consensus, Accuracy, and Consequences of Hearsay Reputations. In R. Rau (Chair), Making good impressions: On the antecedents and consequences of peer reputations. Symposium conducted at the 19th European Conference on Personality (Zadar, Croatia).

item.title: Revealed Traits: A Novel Method for Estimating Cross-Cultural Similarities and Differences in Personality
Stability and Change in the Big Five and Big Six: New Tests of the Maturity and Cumulative Continuity Principles
